attributes.action: instruct the appropriate authority to forbid any action on pavements other than walking! (or pushing prams or push-chairs)
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Pavements used to be called footways.  As the name implies this means they should only be used by pedestrians; i.e. people on foot.  Not cyclists (if they don't feel safe in the road they should dismount and push their bikes beside them), kids on scooters or in "heelies" etc (pavements are not playgrounds; this should take place in parks) and anyone else whose activities place any risk at all to pedestrians.  We have little enough space, and it seems to be regarded as of little importance (e.g. no clearance of snow and ice in the winter), so surely that's the least we can expect (especially since we don't cause any harm to others such as danger of traffic accidents or pollution).

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
